Package com.example.taskadserver.controllers.mvc

Class TaskMvcController

java.lang.Object
com.example.taskadserver.controllers.mvc.TaskMvcController
@Controller @RequestMapping("/tasks") public class TaskMvcController extends Object
The TaskMvcController gets the user requests from the view layer and processes them, with the necessary validations. It acts as an interface between Model and View. The requests are then sent to model for data processing. Once they are processed, the data is sent back to the controller and then displayed on the view.

  • Method Details

    • populateIsAuthenticated

      @ModelAttribute("isAuthenticated") public boolean populateIsAuthenticated(jakarta.servlet.http.HttpSession session)
      Parameters:
      session - is a conversional state between client and server, and it can consist of multiple requests and responses between client and server. Since HTTP and Web Server both are stateless, the only way to maintain a session is when some unique information about the session (session id) is passed between server and client in every request and response.
      Returns:
      if the user is authenticated or not
